docs.snippet: The immigration which has poured into this Territory so rapidly for the last eight weeks has nearly subsided, aid the reaction which it was expected would follow is now plainly manifest.

headline.main: FROM PIKE'S PEAK.; Decrease in Immigration and its Causes-- More Capital and Better Machinery Wanted-Mail Facilities.

docs.lead_paragraph: The immigration which has poured into this Territory so rapidly for the last eight weeks has nearly subsided, aid the reaction which it was expected would follow is now plainly manifest.

docs.snippet: Commissioner JOHNSON returned here on Friday, and has during his absence completed his opinion and report upon the Paraguay question. Additional arguments and evidence were submitted on Saturday to the Commissioners, who will meet tomorrow to...

headline.main: GENERAL TELEGRAPHIC NEWS.; Dispatch to the Associated Press.

docs.lead_paragraph: Commissioner JOHNSON returned here on Friday, and has during his absence completed his opinion and report upon the Paraguay question. Additional arguments and evidence were submitted on Saturday to the Commissioners, who will meet tomorrow to consider the same, and make their award, which will be submitted to the President.

docs.snippet: FLATBUSH-AVENUE RAILROAD. The cars on the Flatbush-avenue Railroad began their through trips on Saturday morning. The fare has been fixed at 10 cents, or 8 cents if tickets are purchased. To any point within the city limits five cents will be...
docs.lead_paragraph: FLATBUSH-AVENUE RAILROAD. The cars on the Flatbush-avenue Railroad began their through trips on Saturday morning. The fare has been fixed at 10 cents, or 8 cents if tickets are purchased. To any point within the city limits five cents will be charged, or four cents by ticket.

headline.main: Police Reports.; THEFT AND RECOVERY OF VALUABLE HARNESS.

docs.lead_paragraph: Capt. WALLING recently received information from the authorities of New-Brunswick, N.J., that a series of robberies had been committed at that place, chiefly of harness, sleigh robes and stable equipments, the wealthy residents of the village being the sufferers, but no clue to the thief had been obtained.

docs.snippet: The President and Miss LANE, accompanied by Mrs. COBB, Secretary TOUCEY, and a distinguished party, left the city yesterday morning at about 7  o'clock, by special train for Annapolis, to visit the monster steamship Great Eastern, now on exhibition...

headline.main: The Visit of the President to the Great Eastern.

docs.lead_paragraph: The President and Miss LANE, accompanied by Mrs. COBB, Secretary TOUCEY, and a distinguished party, left the city yesterday morning at about 7 o'clock, by special train for Annapolis, to visit the monster steamship Great Eastern, now on exhibition there.

docs.snippet: This has been the first really warm time we have had since the Prince of WALES landed in  America. With one remarkable exception, there has not been a cloud in the sky to-day, from dusty morn to sultry eve, and the thermometer has run up into the...

headline.main: Doings at Frederickton.; THE FIRST REALLY HOT DAY THE PRINCE HAS HAD ADDRESSES, LEVEES, PUBLIC CEREMOMONIES, BALLS FREDERICKTON TIPSY.

docs.lead_paragraph: This has been the first really warm time we have had since the Prince of WALES landed in America. With one remarkable exception, there has not been a cloud in the sky to-day, from dusty morn to sultry eve, and the thermometer has run up into the nineties.

docs.snippet: It is understood here that Capt. SAMUEL JONES, of the First Artillery, will be appointed Commandant at West Point.

headline.main: GENERAL TELEGRAPHIC NEWS.; FROM WASHINGTON. Military Affairs Decision on the Paraguay Claims The Prince of Wales to Visit Fortress Monroe The Treasury, &c.

docs.lead_paragraph: It is understood here that Capt. SAMUEL JONES, of the First Artillery, will be appointed Commandant at West Point.

docs.snippet: QUARANTINE AND THE PUBLIC HEALTH. Mr. CYRUS CURTISS has addressed several interrogatories to Dr. A.H. GUNN, the Health Officer of the Port, touching the enforcement of Quarantine regulations upon emigrant and other vessels arriving with passengers...
docs.lead_paragraph: QUARANTINE AND THE PUBLIC HEALTH. Mr. CYRUS CURTISS has addressed several interrogatories to Dr. A.H. GUNN, the Health Officer of the Port, touching the enforcement of Quarantine regulations upon emigrant and other vessels arriving with passengers after long voyages, and also relative to the facilities which he has, under the present Quarantine regime ...
